[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/31834227/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/31834227)

Coverage decreased (-0.2%) to 96.364% when pulling **551edc722bde831be358cd5f09527d90854ffd54 on 2057-illiad-myaccount2** into **4bfda96ae4eadeb6787aad2fb6d38a7b311d50c7 on master**.

orangelight.title: Locator request to catalog causing error

comments.body: The stackmap route in OL is only useful if a "loc" parameter containing a current voyager shelf location code is passed to it. We should handle any requests to this route without this parameter in a more graceful way that avoids the 500 error.
This bib ID in the example URLs doesn't even exist. I wonder where is URL is coming from. The locator.php URL is a URI used to call a firestone map that is embedded via iframe for books in firestone.

comments.body:
On July 2, 2020 Lynn Durgin wrote:
>Hi Cliff, 

Thank you for reaching out. 

Yes; the Figgy resources are ready to be matched up with their component IDs.

In addition, many changes were made to the item metadata, so the fields: title, subject, date, end date, approximate, location, photographer and description should all be uploaded into Figgy to replace what is currently there. Changes were not only made to the items that had notes from Barksdale, so the metadata for all of the items should be replaced. Does that make sense?

We plan to begin working on the Historical Postcard Collection next week. Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Thank you,
Lynn
Kim  will write to  Julie Mellby about this
